subsections.title: Background
subsections.content: Malawi, formerly Nyasaland, was under British colonial rule.
points: Part of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland (1953–1963).

subsections.title: Independence Movement
subsections.content: Malawians organized themselves to fight for self-rule.
points: Malawi Congress Party (MCP) was formed to demand independence.
Protests, petitions, and political organization increased pressure on colonial authorities.

subsections.title: Key Leader
subsections.content: Dr. Hastings Kamuzu Banda was the central figure in Malawi’s fight for independence.
points: Returned from abroad in 1958 to lead the movement.
Later became Malawi's first Prime Minister and President.

subsections.title: Independence Achievement
points: Celebrated annually as Malawi’s Independence Day.
